response: "Why does everyone expect me to be perfect? It's like there's no room for mistakes or flaws."
"I feel like I'm constantly under a microscope, being judged for every little thing. It's suffocating."
"I'm starting to lose myself in this pressure to be perfect. I don't even know who I am anymore."
"It's overwhelming trying to meet society's impossible standards. I'm exhausted from pretending to have it all together."
"I'm trapped in a cycle of comparison, always feeling like I'm falling short. It's driving me crazy."
